It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical, segmented stems and narrow, strap-like leaves that form a rosette. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with showy, red-orange flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
